pyoptools.wavefront.psurfrep¶

Class List¶

  • PSurf

Available Classes¶

class pyoptools.wavefront.psurfrep.PSurf(s, ni=1, nr=1, ilimit=0, slimit=1.3, l=.633e-3, step=0.05, order=10, rsamples=(500, 500), zb=None)¶

Class used to describe the wave transfer function of an optical surface using a polynomial representation algorithm.

AVAILABLE METHODS

propagate(self, wf, pt=0.001, samples=(512, 512))¶

Propagate a Wavefront through the modelled surface.

wf – wave front to propagate pt – Percentage of the power spectrum that must be truncated.

If no truncation is intended, set to 1

samples – Samples of the resulting wave

pw_evaluate(self, np.ndarray[, np.double_t, ndim=1], k, samples=(512, 512), gpu=True)¶

Plane wave evaluate

Arguments:

k – Propagation direction of the incident plane wave

wf_polys(self, np.ndarray[, np.double_t, ndim=1], k)¶

Return the polynomials that describe the wavefront

(fase_poly, i_poly)
